TEXT.citation: Indigenous Languages Research and Development Foundation. (2020). 族語E樂園. https://web.klokah.tw/

S.FORM: sabau makanaelre. kaiasaa aibulruaku numiya ikai akanea ku vaga ki Ngudradrekai tumana luiya.
S.TRANSL: 大家好。今天老師要教大家食物的魯凱語怎麼說。
Hello everyone. Today, I’m going to teach you how to say the Rukai word for food.

S.FORM: wathingale su kilalra kai taiya ki singsi?
S.TRANSL: Do you understand what the teacher says?

S.FORM: singsi, kadruwa ka wathingale. aidulru su pela ?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我不懂。可以再說一次嗎?
I don’t understand. Can you repeat it again?

S.FORM: kadruwa ka makakyalalra, aidulru su akwadradrau ?
S.TRANSL: 我聽不到，可以大聲一點嗎?
I can’t hear you, can you speak louder?
請看這裡! 跟著我唸一遍。
Look here, please! Repeat after me.
Read it again. Please speak louder.
I forgot to bring my pen.

S.FORM: singsi, mahimuha ku iluku ku sasupisupilra.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my eraser.

S.FORM: kisalrua inya thili su ku sasupisupilra.
S.TRANSL: 請跟旁邊同學借橡皮擦。
Please borrow erasers from your classmates.

S.FORM: ta pakeakela ikai, kibulru, ta macecelenga lu pela ki takibulrubulrua.
S.TRANSL: 我們就上到這邊，下週再見。
Class dismissed, see you next week.

S.FORM: lalaka ku ki Legeai, sia Sula ku.
S.TRANSL: I am the son of Legeai, and my name is Sula.

S.FORM: situa ku ki Kui, sia Sula ku.
S.TRANSL: I am a student in Kui, my name is Sula.

S.FORM: ku nagane ki tamasu sia anea?
ku nagane ki ama sia Legeai.

S.TRANSL: He is my brother, his name is Kecelre.
她是我的朋友，她的名字是Kaniyu。
She is my friend and her name is Kaniyu.

S.FORM: tahapiyanga ku caili ki tama su kaiasaa?
ku ama kaiasaa tahamalrimalenga ka caili.

S.TRANSL: How many brothers and sisters do you have?

S.FORM: yakai ku tadrusa ku kake, tangea ku agi li.
S.TRANSL: 我有兩個兄姐，一個弟妹。
I have two brothers and sisters and one younger brother and sister.
How many people are in your family?
There are four of us in our family.

S.FORM: manema ku aunga ki betaka ki tinasu?
S.TRANSL: 你的舅舅從事什麼工作?
What does your uncle do for a living?

S.FORM: yakai ku aunga ki taka ka ababai?
S.TRANSL: Does your sister have a job?
他們兩個人是兄弟姐妹嗎?
Yes, but she is a Paiwan.
Yes, we are all very tall.
Does your sister go to school?
Do your siblings speak the language?
Yes, they speak the ethnic language.
How many brothers and sisters do you have?
I have three brothers and sisters.

S.FORM: taelre su ki tama su si tina su cekecekele?
S.TRANSL: 你和爸爸媽媽一起住嗎?
Do you live with your parents?

S.FORM: eene, taelrea ku ki ama si ina cekecekele.
S.TRANSL: 是，我和爸爸媽媽一起住。
Yes, I live with my mom and dad.

S.FORM: taelre su ki tumu su si kaingu su cekecekele?
S.TRANSL: 你和爺爺奶奶一起住嗎?
Do you live with your grandparents?

S.FORM: ini, kadruwa ku ka taelre liniya cekecekele.
S.TRANSL: 不，我沒和跟他們一起住。
No, I didn’t live with them.

S.FORM: taelrea ku ki ama, ina, si kake ka sauwalai cekecekele.
S.TRANSL: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥住在一起。
I live with my father, mother and brother.
你什麼時候會回去部落?
When are you going back to the tribe?

S.FORM: lu taibalribalriva ki kaladrangedranga taha mwabalriva ku.
S.TRANSL: I will go back in the summer.
The sun is coming out, it's very hot.
Is it going to be cold outside?
It's cold, so wear more clothes.

S.FORM: kaiasaa kadruwa ka makecelre kadruwa ka wadrangedrange, pakamaesaimadu.
S.TRANSL: 今天不冷也不熱，很舒服。
It's neither cold nor hot today, very comfortable.

S.FORM: kadruwa ku emeeme subelebelenge, ngyabualenga ku tahiyau.
S.TRANSL: 天空沒有雲，星星出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky; the stars came out.
雨剛剛停，出了太陽，彩虹出來了。
The rain has just stopped, the sun has come out, the rainbow is coming out.
We're going to have a big storm here.
Very well, out of the big sun.
I have to go to school.
The weather is very cold, so wear more clothes.

S.FORM: aiudale tahuadrau luasaa, ngulringava iluku ku lenai.
S.TRANSL: 等一下會下大雨，你要記得帶傘。
It's going to rain heavily, you have to remember to bring an umbrella.
剛剛打雷了，等一下應該就會下雨。
There was thunder just now, and it's supposed to rain later.
剛剛有下雨，現在雨停了。
It just rained, and now it's stopped.
好像下過雨了，馬路是濕的。
It seems to have rained and the road is wet.
有下雨嗎?你怎麼全身都濕了?
Is it raining? Why are you all wet?

S.FORM: waudawdale latadre, kadruwa ka wailuku ku lenai.
S.TRANSL: 外面在下雨，我沒有帶雨傘。
It's raining outside, so I didn't bring an umbrella.

S.FORM: ngyacaeme kai saseveha, pakiangeange ki aulruli.
S.TRANSL: The wind is blowing so hard that my head hurts.

S.FORM: ngyacaeme kai vai, mabithengelre kai aulruli ki takuvaiya.
S.TRANSL: 太陽好大，曬得我頭好暈。
The sun is so big, it makes me dizzy.

S.FORM: mahimuha ku kai iluku ku cingpi.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my pen.

S.FORM: mahimuha ku kai iluku ku kacipi.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my chopsticks.

S.FORM: miyalria ku kai iluku, ilata langai.
S.TRANSL: I don’t have one either, let’s go buy one.
Let’s go buy a pen, shall we?

S.FORM: eene, aitaku langadha ku ku sasupisupilra.
S.TRANSL: Well, I still have to buy erasers.
Let’s go get breakfast, shall we?

S.FORM: mahimuha ku kai pakaculu ikai laulri.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to steam my lunchbox.
I forgot to bring my lunchbox.
那我們一起吃我的便當吧!
Then let’s eat my lunch box together!

S.FORM: aikane su ku manema lu mudringedele?
S.TRANSL: What are you having for lunch?

S.FORM: aikanea ku ku padulru ki swagaku ka kudrali.
S.TRANSL: 我要吃學校的營養午餐。
I want a nutritious school lunch.

S.FORM: aikane su ku manema ki mulringedele?
S.TRANSL: What are you having for lunch?
我今天有帶便當，我們中午一起吃吧!
I’ve brought a lunchbox today, let’s eat together at noon!
Let’s go play basketball, shall we?
Please help me with the broom.
Okay, here’s a broomstick for you.
Can you help me with the cloth?
I’m sweeping the floor and you asked Usau to carry it for you.
The floor is dirty, go clean it.
Okay, I’ll go get the cloth.
那個窗戶很髒，去擦一下。
That window is very dirty, go clean it.

S.FORM: drengehana, kadruwana ka twalrepenge selredre ikaivai.
S.TRANSL: 等一下，我還沒掃完這裡。
Wait a minute, I’m not done sweeping here yet.
I’m going to see my teacher.
What do you do after school?
I’m going to sing with my friends.
She’s at home, please come in.
她不在，請問你有什麼事?
She’s not here, what can I do for you?
Grandpa, I’m Muakadha, please open the door.

S.FORM: Camake, Muakadha ku, wakela ku silape musuwa.
S.TRANSL: Camake, I’m Muakadha, I’ve come to play with you.

S.FORM: eene! mabahengeha ku musuwa. nyama takalaelange.
S.TRANSL: 是啊!我很想念你。快來聊天吧!
Yeah! I miss you so much. Come on, let’s chat!
Please sit down and have some tea.

S.FORM: eenela! lucela ikai lamadru ki angatu alamatiadalame.
S.TRANSL: 好喔!這些水果看起來很棒。

S.FORM: madunga ku aga ki tinaita ka kwaubu, nyama kwanea!
S.TRANSL: 媽媽煮好晚餐了，快來吃吧!
Mom has cooked dinner, come and eat!
Okay, I’ll go wash my hands.

S.FORM: palrainga kwane si ungulu, kaumase su.
S.TRANSL: 盡量吃喝，你又不是外人。
Try to eat and drink as much as possible, you’re not an outsider.
I ate a lot, I’m full.
我要離開了，下次再來看你。
I’m leaving, I’ll see you next time.

S.FORM: eene, lu picugu su kelanga avaevaehe.
S.TRANSL: Okay, come to my house sometime.

S.FORM: sabau makanaelre, kaiasaa aiiluka ku numiya mucekele kitububulru ki mahudrange.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，老師今天要帶大家去部落訪問耆老。
Hello everyone, today I’m taking you to the tribe to interview the elders.
好喔!我們要跟耆老說魯凱語。
Okay! We’re going to say Tarumake to the seniors.
Grandpa, we’ve come to see you.

S.FORM: be! wathingale numi ngudradreadrekadha! saniange numi!
S.TRANSL: 你們會說魯凱語啊!真是太棒了!

S.FORM: sabau makanaelre, kaiasaa aiiluka ku numiya mwa ki becebecenge twatuma.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，老師今天要帶大家去小米田工作。
Hello everyone, today I will take you to work in the millet field.

S.FORM: nyama siuga makanaelre, ngulringava iluku ku satwatuma.
S.TRANSL: 大家過來排隊，記得帶好工具。
Come and line up, remember to bring your tools.

S.FORM: eene, singsi, padulrunga nai ku satwatuma.
S.TRANSL: 是的，老師，我們都拿好工具了。
Yes, sir, we’ve got our tools.
Not yet, it’s still far away.
You go get the bird catcher.
Okay, I’ll go and catch the birds.

S.FORM: sabau makanaelre, kaiasaa aiuwata ki taikaikaiya ki wagulagulai.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，我們今天要去動物園。
Hello everyone, we are going to the zoo today.
好棒喔!我們要怎麼去呢?
Awesome! How are we going to get there?
大家排好隊，我們準備買票。
Everyone line up, we are ready to buy tickets.

S.FORM: kai cucubungu ladhadhame, kwani lrilrikudru lalawlai, ngikakamaniya syavava.
S.TRANSL: 前面是鳥類，後面是蛇類，大家自己參觀。
There are birds in the front and snakes in the back.
It doesn’t matter, then you go and watch the birds.

S.FORM: lu ngilribate ki ea ka tuki wakelamadu ikai ihubu.
S.TRANSL: 我們一個小時後回來集合。
We’ll be back in an hour.

S.FORM: wacela ku ku makalra ku alawlai, si makalra ka adhadhame.
S.TRANSL: 我看到了好多蛇，還有好多鳥。
I saw a lot of snakes and a lot of birds.
Hurry up, we have to go.
Wait for me, my feet are tired.
There are a lot of people swimming here.

S.FORM: madrau mwadringi ku acilai nakauwai, ta ikaikai sikathaa.
S.TRANSL: 那裡水很深，我們在這裡游泳就好。
The water is deep there, so we just swim here.
What kind of car did you take?
How do you go to church?
How does he usually go to school?
He took the subway to school.

S.FORM: twatwatuma lu langai ku lacenge ku kaingu su?
S.TRANSL: How does your grandmother go to the grocery store?

S.FORM: ngwakai ki utubai lwangai ku lacenge.
S.TRANSL: She went to the grocery store on a motorcycle.
How are you going to get to Orchid Island?
I want to take a boat to Lanyu.
How did he get to Orchid Island?
He took a plane to Orchid Island.

S.FORM: aingukai ki manema mutakau kau lasu?
S.TRANSL: What bus did he take to Kaohsiung?
He took the THSR to Kaohsiung.

S.FORM: ngwakai ki kisa muTaitu kau lasu?
S.TRANSL: Did he take a train to Taitung?
Yes, he took a train to Taitung.

S.FORM: ngwakai ki kisa muTaitu kau lasu?
S.TRANSL: Did he take a train to Taitung?
No, he took a plane to Taitung.

S.FORM: kai ngwadadethe yakai ku taisadrasadra ki base?
S.TRANSL: Is there a bus stop near here?

S.FORM: yakai, papu cucubunga dwavace aicele su.
S.TRANSL: 有，往前走就會看到公車站了。
Yes, if you go straight ahead, you will see the bus stop.

S.FORM: ku sadedethenga ikai ku ciying yakai inu?
S.TRANSL: 離這裡最近的捷運站在哪裡?
Where is the nearest MRT station?

S.FORM: kadruwa ku tisaba ki ciying ikai, sakatha ku haiya ku adulruwanesu ngukai.
S.TRANSL: 這裡沒有捷運站，你只能坐計程車。
There is no MRT station here, you can only take a taxi.

S.FORM: lu ngukaiya ki base tahathainumadu la kela gaku?
S.TRANSL: How long does it take to get to the school by bus?

S.FORM: lu ngukaiya ki kauti tahathainumadu la kela Taiciyu?
S.TRANSL: 搭高鐵要多久時間會到臺中?
How long does it take to get to Taichung by THSR?

S.FORM: ngwaeamadu ki tuki la kela Taiciyu.
S.TRANSL: I will come to Taichung in an hour.

S.FORM: maulaimadu lu ungtinga ki didyusa mwaUlai?
S.TRANSL: Is it a long drive to Ulai?

S.FORM: tahathainu lu ngukai su ki kauti kela naiyana?
S.TRANSL: 你搭捷運來我家要多久?
How long did it take you to come to my house by subway?
Do you know how to ride a bicycle?
Don’t, I don’t know much about it.

S.FORM: lu makamulringedele pyacugu su? nau kitububulru amiya ku musuwa, palraingi su?
S.TRANSL: 你下午有空嗎?我想去拜訪你可以嗎?
Are you free this afternoon? I’d like to visit you, is that okay?

S.FORM: eene, nau ikainga tauwana mukalava musuwa.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I’ll wait for you at home.

S.FORM: ludhaa aipicugu su? apya kitububulruwa ku musuwa ku pathahwakai ki ngudradrekai ka maulai.
S.TRANSL: 你明天有空嗎?我想請問你關於魯凱族的傳說故事。
Are you free tomorrow? I’d like to ask you about the legendary story of the Rukai.

S.FORM: ludhaa aimulregelrega ku, kadruwa ku ka aiikai tauwana.
S.TRANSL: 明天我要去山上，不在家喔。
I’m going to the mountains tomorrow, so I won’t be home.

S.FORM: kyalalra ku ku ngyathingale ku kakwakudha ki ngudradrekai amiya musuwa, naikitububulrwa ku musuwa?
S.TRANSL: 我聽說您對魯凱族的傳統習俗非常了解，想要請教您一下。
I heard that you are very familiar with the traditional customs of the Rukai, so I would like to ask you a few questions.

S.FORM: kadruwa ka thainu ku thingaleli, ai aipelaela ku ku kelretananeli.
S.TRANSL: 我所了解的不多，但是我會盡量回答。
I don’t know much about it, but I will try to answer as best I can.

S.FORM: aimaka tukacudua ku? lupiyaku inya mapadudulrua ku tupacase kiruku.
S.TRANSL: 請問我可以錄影嗎?這樣以後比較容易記錄。
Can I record the video? It will be easier to record in the future.

S.FORM: ku tauwane su miyalri ka ngudradrekai?
S.TRANSL: 請問您的太太也是魯凱族人嗎?

S.FORM: wathingale su kauhiva ku swaininuana ku vaga?
wathingala ku kauhiva ku ngubabubuculana si swasungava.
S.TRANSL: 我會說排灣語和布農語。
I can speak Paiwan and Bunun.

S.FORM: kaiasaa mitiyakihagai ladulruwaku kitububulru musawa, lamatikaiya, luamanema ku twalrisiya lu alupu?
S.TRANSL: 今天很高興能訪問您，請您談一下，有關狩獵的禁忌好嗎?
It’s a pleasure to interview you today, can you talk about the taboo of hunting?

S.FORM: eene, saicengecenga ku taha alupa ku.
S.TRANSL: 好的。我年輕的時候很常上山打獵。
Yes. I used to go hunting in the mountains when I was young.

S.FORM: maelanenga kaitabulruane su kaiasaa matiadalame tuhamuhu.
S.TRANSL: 謝謝，您今天所教導的真是太棒了。
Thank you, what you taught me today was really great.

S.FORM: kai taiyaneli patengatenga demedeme, pelaela paususulu ki cucungula.
S.TRANSL: 我所説的都是千真萬確的，祖先所流傳的講述。
All that I say is true, the sayings of my ancestors.

S.FORM: tapakeakela ikaivai kai takitububulruaneli. maelanenga kai tapelaelane su.
S.TRANSL: 今天的訪談就到這邊。非常謝謝您的分享。
That’s all for today’s interview. Thank you very much for sharing with us.

S.FORM: aidavacengana ku, syadramaku ku akilalra ku makakalra ku maulai lubibilrili.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開了，期待下次聽到更多的故事。
I’m going to leave now and look forward to hearing more stories next time.
Hello, what are you looking for?
I want to buy a cup.
Hello, what are you looking for?
I want to buy a hat.

S.FORM: ailangadha ku ku kupu, kyalangalangai numi?
S.TRANSL: 我要買杯子，你們有賣嗎?
I want to buy a cup, do you sell them?
Yes, how many do you want to buy?

S.FORM: kadruwa, kadruwa nai ka kyalangalangai ku sabiki.
S.TRANSL: No, we don't sell betel nut.
How many packs do you want to buy?
I want to buy sweet potatoes.
All the sweet potatoes are sold out.
I want to buy two bottles of oil.
We only have one bottle left.

S.FORM: mwa palribulu nakuwa lwangai ku batuku.

S.TRANSL: How many pounds do you want to buy?

S.FORM: aingupiya su ki tingitingi ikai batuku?
S.TRANSL: How many pounds of eggs do you want to buy?
I want to buy two catties.

S.FORM: ailangadha ku ku kucai ku drusa ka eheheca.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy two green onions.

S.FORM: tutulrunga ka eheheca, nau baainga musuwa demedeme.
S.TRANSL: There are three left, all for you!

S.FORM: kai akuaea ki lumase ka pagai piya ku paisu?
S.TRANSL: How much is this bag of rice?

S.FORM: ku akuea ki lumase drusa ka idai.
demedeme mapusale si ea, tumapwapusalanga sikathaa.
yakai kai mabangate si lrima ka balrula.
nau langaiyana ku bebekela, anidalunga ki idai ka balrula.
S.TRANSL: I'll buy some more, and make up 100 yuan.

S.FORM: demedeme lrima ka idai si mangeale.
makucingalre kaivai, aidulru su tupadudulru ku bekela?
S.TRANSL: 這個太貴了，可以算便宜一點嗎?
It's too expensive, can you make it cheaper?
不行，這個已經很便宜了。
No, this is already very cheap.
I want this packet of cookies.

S.FORM: kai pingkang matulrulu ka balrula, yakaiyana ku muhikai su?
S.TRANSL: 這餅乾30元，還需要別的東西嗎?
$30 for the cookies, anything else you need?

S.FORM: aimaka kisalrwa ku musuwa ku paisu?
S.TRANSL: Can I borrow money from you?
Yes! How much do you need?

S.FORM: mahimuha ku kai iluku ku paisu, aimaka kisalrwa ku musuwa?
S.TRANSL: 我忘記帶錢了，我可以跟你借錢嗎?
I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

S.FORM: miyalriya ku kai iluku ku paisu.
S.TRANSL: I don’t have any money either!

S.FORM: mahimuha ku kai iluku ku paisu, aimaka kisalrwa ku musuwa?
S.TRANSL: 我忘記帶錢了，我可以跟你借錢嗎?
I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

S.FORM: iniyaku, ku kisalru su nakuwa ku paswalala kadruwa su ka wasaulriyana nakuwa.
S.TRANSL: 不要，上次借的錢你都還沒還我。
No, you haven’t paid me back the money you borrowed last time.

S.FORM: aimaka kisalrwa ku ku kahingalai su?

S.TRANSL: 請借給我你的腳踏車好嗎?
Can I borrow your bicycle, please?

S.FORM: eene, ai ludhaa aisaulri su nakuwa,
S.TRANSL: Okay, but you have to give it back to me tomorrow.

S.FORM: waudawdalenga, kadruwa ka wailuku ku lenai, pakisalrwaili ku lenai ene?
S.TRANSL: 下雨了，我沒有帶傘，借我傘好嗎?
It’s raining, I don’t have an umbrella, can you lend me one?
我只有一把傘，我們一起撐吧!
I only have an umbrella, let’s stick together!

S.FORM: kaivai amani kudra pakisalru su nakuwa ku paswalala ka hungu, nau saulri musuwa.
S.TRANSL: 這是你上次借我的書，還給你。
This is the book you borrowed from me last time, I give it back to you.

S.FORM: manemaneana ku apicele su ku hungu pelaelaili.
S.TRANSL: 還想看什麼書都可以跟我說。
You can tell me what else you want to read.

S.FORM: aisaulriya ku musuwa luiga ikai paisu?
S.TRANSL: When do I have to pay you back?

S.FORM: aikatuma, singkaiyanga luikainga ku paisu su.
S.TRANSL: 沒關係，你有錢的時候再說。
It’s okay, you can talk about it when you have money.

S.FORM: luiga aisaulri su nakuwa ku paisu?
S.TRANSL: When are you going to pay me back?
I’ll return it to you tomorrow.

S.FORM: aisaulri su nakuwa luiga idra hungu?
S.TRANSL: When are you going to return my book?
我昨天不是已經還你了嗎?
Didn’t I return it to you yesterday?

S.FORM: kaivai cingpi pakisalru musuwa ki Pacake?
S.TRANSL: Did Pacake lend you this pen?
Yes, I borrowed it from him today.

S.FORM: kaivai cingpi kisalru su ki Pacake?
S.TRANSL: Did you borrow this pen from Pacake?
No, this is what mom bought.

S.FORM: kadruwanga ku timu, mwa kisalru ki Muni ku bekela.
S.TRANSL: We’re out of salt, let’s go borrow some from Muni.

S.FORM: swaulriya mya ki Muni idra paisuli.
S.TRANSL: Go tell Muni to give me back my money.

S.FORM: piya ku kyame musuwa ku paisu?
S.TRANSL: How much does she owe you?
I’m going to plant vegetables in the garden.

S.FORM: makalra tuhamuhu kai ubulu, wadangedangedanga ku, luasaa aipwaciladha ku.
S.TRANSL: 草太多了，我在砍草，等一下要澆水。
There’s too much grass, I’m cutting it, I’ll have to water it later.

S.FORM: palribulaili malra inya kulringi si tatukunu ene?
S.TRANSL: 幫我把鐮刀和鋤頭拿來好嗎?
Will you get my scythes and hoes, please?
Put it next to the plow rake.
Did you turn over the soil?
我剛翻過土，等等要播種。
I just turned over the soil, and so on to sow seeds.

S.FORM: ku lredreke su ku lacenge aidulrungata kilacenge?
S.TRANSL: 你種的菜可以收成了嗎?
Are your vegetables ready to be harvested?

S.FORM: aidulrunga ta kilacenge ikai kangdrang, kwani lasyasina kadruwa ka sakilacelacengeana.
S.TRANSL: 這裡的甘藍可以收成了，那裡的昭和草就還不能收成。
The cabbage here is ready to be harvested, but the Showa grass there is not yet ready to be harvested.

S.FORM: be! ani kakalra kai kibuhasi su.
S.TRANSL: 哇!你挖了這麼多的地瓜。
Wow! You dug up so many gourds.

S.FORM: palribulaili pudringai pikai ki drausulu ene?
S.TRANSL: Will you help me with the barn?
We’re releasing fishing nets to catch fish.

S.FORM: makalranga ku kaange ku yakai ki humuku.
S.TRANSL: 魚簍裡已經抓了很多魚。
The fish basket has been full of fish.
How do you usually catch fish?
I shoot fish with a spear.

S.FORM: wathingale su ahakai ku lraili walupu?
S.TRANSL: Do you know how to hunt with a bow and arrow?

S.FORM: ngikakalrala ku ahakai ku kateme malra ku pana, yakailu alra ku ku kwange si iluku ku taupungu walupu.
S.TRANSL: 我通常都是用陷阱抓獵物，偶爾也會拿槍帶狗狩獵。
I usually catch my prey with a trap, but occasionally I hunt with a gun and a dog.

S.FORM: kaivai ka dalrane ki babui ka ulu.
S.TRANSL: This is the road the boar took.

S.FORM: kaivai ka dalrane ki babui, lamani ku ulu ki babui.
S.TRANSL: 這是山豬的腳印，所以這是山豬所走的路。
These are the footprints of the boar, so this is the path the boar took.

S.FORM: ila ta cele idra kateme ta, tali yakainga ku nipana.
S.TRANSL: 快去看我們的陷阱，好像抓到獵物了。
Go and see our trap, for it seems that we have caught our prey.

S.FORM: myaki wasabalringa kai taupungu. ila ta tupapalra.
S.TRANSL: 狗好像聞到味道了。我們快跟過去。
The dog seems to have smelled it. Let’s follow them.
你正在製作的是什麼東西?

S.FORM: kaivai ka takebe ka tukulru, sahakaiya pwalra ki tulriki.
S.TRANSL: 這是石壓式陷阱，用來抓老鼠的。
This is a stone trap, used to catch rats.

S.FORM: manema kwani sahahe su pikai iniya?
S.TRANSL: 你放在那裡的是什麼東西?
What is that thing you put there?

S.FORM: kwani ka pinadrapala ka tukulru, ahakainai inya pwalra ku akece.
S.TRANSL: 那是套腳式繩索陷阱，我們用它來抓山羌。
It was a leg-rigged rope trap, and we used it to catch Shankiang.

S.FORM: maelanenga ku tasubulrubulrua ki cucungulaneta, kaiasaa makalra kai panata,
S.TRANSL: 感謝祖靈賜福，今天我們有很多獵物收獲。
Thanks to the blessing of our ancestors, we had a great harvest today.

S.FORM: eene, ilata iluku pubalriyu pakisupilri ki sakacekeleta.
S.TRANSL: 是啊!我們帶回部落好好分享吧!
Yeah! Let’s take it back to the tribe and share it!

S.FORM: kaiasaa aibulruwaku numiya tumana luiya ngudradreadrekadhana ikai udryudripi.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教大家動物的魯凱語怎麼說。
I will teach everyone all kinds of animals in Ngudradrekay language today.

S.FORM: kaiasaa aibulruwaku numiya tumana luiya ngudradreadrekadhana ikai lauwacebecebe.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教大家植物的魯凱語怎麼說。

S.FORM: kaiasaa aibulruwaku numiya tumana luiya ngudradreadrekadhana ikai madru ki angatu.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教大家水果的魯凱語怎麼說。
I will teach everyone all kinds of fruits in Ngudradrekay language today.

S.FORM: singsi, kadruwa ka wailuku ku hungu li.
S.TRANSL: Teacher, I didn’t bring my textbook.
Share the book with your classmate next to you.
I will lend you my eraser.

S.FORM: aitulrepengenga ta, cwacela ki kaelrelrea lu mutauwananenumi.
S.TRANSL: 我們要下課了，回家路上要小心!
It is the end of the class, be careful on your way home.
我們要下課了，大家再見。
The class is over, goodbye everyone.

S.FORM: sabau makanaelre, ku nagane li sya Kui.
S.TRANSL: Hello everyone, my name is Kui.

S.FORM: sabau makanaelre, ku nagane li sya Usau.
S.TRANSL: Hello everyone, my name is Usau.

S.FORM: sabau, sya Kui ku nagane li.
tina ku ki Paehece sya Muakadha ku.
amaniya ku kudra agi ki Paehece, ku nagane li sya Tuku.
S.TRANSL: 我是Paehece的妹妹，我的名字是Tuku。
I am Paehece’s sister. My name is Tuku.

S.FORM: sya anea ku nagane ki taka ka ababai?
S.TRANSL: What is your elder sister’s name?

S.FORM: ku nagane ki kake ka ababai sya Suhigu.
S.TRANSL: My elder sister’s name is Suhigu.

S.FORM: sya anea ku nagane ki agi ka ababai?
S.TRANSL: What is your younger sister’s name?

S.FORM: sya Manenge ku nagane ki agi li ka ababai.
S.TRANSL: My younger sister’s name is Manenge.

S.FORM: tahapiyanga ku caili ki taka ka sauwalai?
S.TRANSL: How old is your elder brother?

S.FORM: tahamangealenga si lrima ku caili ini.
tahapiyanga ku caili ki agi ka sauwalai?
S.TRANSL: How old is your younger brother?

S.FORM: yakai ku gaku ki cekele numi?
S.TRANSL: Do you have schools in your community?

S.FORM: kyabulru su ikai ki gaku ki cekele numi?
S.TRANSL: 你在部落的學校讀書嗎?
Do you study in your tribe’s school?

S.FORM: eene, myaki nai wacekecekele lu ikainai gaku kibulru.
S.TRANSL: 是的，在學校讀書我們像一家人。
Yes, we are like family while we are studying at school.

S.FORM: manema ku aunga ki tina su?
S.TRANSL: 你的媽媽從事什麼工作?

S.FORM: manema ku aunga ki tama su?
S.TRANSL: 你的爸爸從事什麼工作?
不是，他是我弟弟的朋友。
No, he is my younger brother’s friend.
No, she is my younger sister.
How many people in their family?
There are five people in their family.
How many children in your family?
There are four children in our family.
How many younger siblings do you have?

S.FORM: kadruwa ku agi li ku sauwalai, tatulru ku agi li ka ababai.
S.TRANSL: 我沒有弟弟，有三位妹妹。
I don’t have any younger brothers, but I have three younger sisters.
How many older siblings do you have?
I don’t have any older siblings.
How many siblings do you have?

S.FORM: makecelre palalrange, pangiadrava ungulu ku maculu ka acilai.
S.TRANSL: 天氣有點冷，要多喝熱水。
It’s a bit cold, so you need to drink more warm water.

S.FORM: wadrangedrange palalrange, pangyadrau madu ungulu ku acilai.
S.TRANSL: It’s a bit hot, so you need to drink more water.

S.FORM: ngyacaeme kai vai, ngulringava kibalai ki vai.
S.TRANSL: The sun is bright and remember to wear sunscreen.

S.FORM: makalra ku emeeme, kadruwa ku vai subelebelenge.
S.TRANSL: There are a lot of clouds but no sun in the sky.

S.FORM: ludhaa aikadruwa ku vai, lai kakalra ku emeeme, si kasasevehe.
S.TRANSL: 明天沒有太陽，雲很多，風很大。
It will be cloudy and windy but not sunny tomorrow.

S.FORM: lu ataavaevahaneta idra vayvai aingituma ku vai?
S.TRANSL: How’s the weather on the day we go out?

S.FORM: lu ataavaevahaneta idra vayvai aikakecelre, syaebelemadu lu mulatadra.
S.TRANSL: 那天會有點冷，出門要穿外套。
It will be a bit cold and you need to wear a jacket when you go outside.
How’s the weather on the weekend?
It will be sunny on the weekend.
Will it be rainy on the day we go out?

S.FORM: lu ataavaevahaneta idra vayvai aivai, kadruwa ka aiudale.
S.TRANSL: 出遊那天天氣會晴朗，不會下雨。
It will have no rain and be sunny that day.
Will it be rainy on the day we go out?

S.FORM: eene, aiudale lu ataavaevahaneta ka vai.
S.TRANSL: Yes, it will be rainy that day.
The rain stops and the sun comes out.

S.FORM: waudawdalenga, kadruwa ka wailuku ku lenai.
S.TRANSL: It is raining and I don’t have an umbrella with me.

S.FORM: kadruwa ku udale kaiasasaa, aiudale lu makamulringedele, wailukumadu ku lenai.
S.TRANSL: 現在沒有下雨，中午過後會下雨，出門要帶傘。
It is not raining now, but it will be rainy in the afternoon, so you need to bring an umbrella when you go out.
Will it be very cold in winter next year?

S.FORM: eene, luicaili ki kalakecelra aikakecelre, syalakakalramadu ku kahingalai.
S.TRANSL: 是，明年冬天會很冷，要穿很多衣服。
Yes, it will be very cold in winter next year, so you need to put on extra layers.
Will it be very hot in summer this year?

S.FORM: eene, aidrangedrange lu kaladrangedranga, pangiadrau madu ungulu ku acilai.
S.TRANSL: 是，夏天會很熱，要多喝水。
Yes, it will be very hot and you need to drink more water.

S.FORM: madalama ku ki kalahyahiga. maculu ku vai.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡春天，天氣很溫暖。
I like spring because the weather is warm.

S.FORM: madalame su ki kalamuhuhuwa ki biya?
malrasaku ki kalamuhuhuwa ki biya. makalra ku sedreke.
S.TRANSL: 我不喜歡秋天，秋天有好多颱風。
I don’t like autumn because there are lots of typhoons in autumn.

S.FORM: mahimuha ku kai iluku ku hungu.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring the textbook.
I will share it with you.

S.FORM: mahimuha ku kai iluku ku sasupisupilra.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring the eraser.
Do you forget to bring your pen?
Yes, can you lend me a pen?
What would you like for lunch?
What would you like for dinner?
What did you have for breakfast?
What did you have for lunch?

S.FORM: aswalalaa, nau kelanga silape musuwa luasaa.
S.TRANSL: 你先去，我等一下去找你。
You go first and I will catch up later.
No, we have to carry books first.
Not yet. I am doing the dishes.
Did you rinse out your mouth?
Yes, I rinsed out my mouth.
Why didn’t you wash your hands?
I will wash my hands later.
What were you doing just now?
I went to meet the teacher.
What are you going to do after school?
What is she doing after school?
She is going to go dancing.

S.FORM: kadruwa ku Muni, Muakadhaku yakai ku aunga? nau pelaelanga lu mutauwana ku Muni.
S.TRANSL: Muni不在家耶!我是Muakai，有什麼事嗎? 回來我會轉告Muni。
Muni is not at home. I am Muakadhaku. What can I do for you? I will let him know when he comes back.

S.FORM: kaingu, Munia ku si Muakai, muleba inai!
S.TRANSL: 奶奶，我們是Muni和Muakai，幫我們開門!
Grandma, we are Munia and Muakai, please open the door for us.

S.FORM: Cyamaha ku, wakela ku silape ki Legeai.
S.TRANSL: I am Cyamaha, I am here for Legeai.
Grandma, I am here to see you.
你好久沒來了，我好想念你。
You haven’t been here for a long time. I missed you so much.

S.FORM: Muni, wakela ku ila musuwa kivaevange.
S.TRANSL: Muni, I am here to play with you.

S.FORM: nyama mudana, maulaingana ku mukalava musuwa.
S.TRANSL: Come on in! I have been waiting for you for a long time.
這是我種的地瓜，吃吃看!
This is the sweet potato I grow. Try it!
The sweet potato is so sweet.

S.FORM: nyama! lredrekeli kaivai madru, kwanea palalava.
S.TRANSL: 過來!這是我種的水果，吃看看。
Come here! These are the fruits I grow. You should try it.
請坐! 這是我種的有機玉米吃看看!
Take a seat! You should try some organic corn that I grow.
Wow! The corn tastes so sweet.

S.FORM: kadruwaka aimakakane ku tyanese, nau kane ku pingku sikathaa.
S.TRANSL: 我不能吃橘子，我吃蘋果就好。
I can’t eat oranges. I will have some apples instead.
Sure, I like it very much.

S.FORM: nau kungicu ikai madru sipakane musuwa.
S.TRANSL: Let me peel the fruit for you.

S.FORM: maelanenga, makalra ku esebe ikai madru.
S.TRANSL: Thank you. This fruit is so juicy.

S.FORM: nau alra ku acilai paungulu musuwa.
S.TRANSL: I will bring you some water.

S.FORM: kwanea pangikalra, makalra ku tudamai li.
S.TRANSL: Enjoy yourself. I cooked a lot of dishes.
Oh! It smells good and looks delicious.
Enjoy yourself. There is a lot more.
I’ll make myself at home then.
Enjoy yourself. There are plenty here.
我吃了好多，不能再吃了。
I ate a lot and couldn’t eat any more.
老師今天要帶你們去山上。
I will take you to the mountains today.

S.FORM: makalra ku atatimalau lregelrege amiya ku ina.
S.TRANSL: 媽媽說山上有很多蚊子。
Mom says that there are lots of mosquitoes in the mountains.
老師今天要帶你們去田裡。
I will take you to the fields.
Are we going to loosen the soil?
Teacher will take us to the riverside.
Teacher will take us to the mountains today.
Are we going to the riverside today?

S.FORM: ini, aiiluku mita mulregelrege kau singsi.
S.TRANSL: 不是，老師要帶我們去山上。
No, our teacher is going to take us to the mountains.
Are we going to the mountains today?
不是，我們今天要去田裡。
No, we are going to the fields.

S.FORM: singsi, aiceele ta ku manema mudrakehale?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我們到河邊要看什麼?
Teacher, what are we going to see at the riverside?
We are going to see dragonflies.

S.FORM: singsi, aiceele ta ku manema mulregelrege?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我們到山上要看什麼?
Teacher, what are we going to see in the mountains?
We are going to see butterflies.
What are we going to do in the fields?

S.FORM: aiceele ta ku lredreke ta ku lapanai, cwacela ku adradralrele si valu!
S.TRANSL: 我們要到田裡看我們種的玉米，要小心有螞蟻、蜜蜂唷!
We are going to see the corn we grow in the fields, but you need to be aware of the ants and bees.
老師我們要到河邊游泳嗎?
Teacher, are we going to swim in the river?
No, we are going to see dragonflies.

S.FORM: singsi, aimumawma ta lredreke ku lacenge?
S.TRANSL: 老師我們要到田裡種菜嗎?
Teacher, are we going to grow some vegetables in the fields?
We are going to loosen the soil today.

S.FORM: yakai ku takuaiavithi ku ngyapapapalai nakauwai
aitawceela ku ku panyanyaniyake ku takuaiavithi.
S.TRANSL: 我今天才看過真正活著的蜻蜓。
Today is the first time I see real living dragonflies.

S.FORM: yakai ku alivaevaha ku ngyapapapalai nakauwai.
ye! wa! madalama ku ki alivaevaha, mathahihi!
S.TRANSL: 耶!哇!我喜歡蝴蝶，很漂亮。
Yeh! Wow! I love butterflies. They are very beautiful.

S.FORM: yakai ku alivaevaha ku ngyapapapalai nakauwai.

S.TRANSL: Those are not butterflies. They are bees.
在這裡看一看，不要到太遠的地方唷!
Come here and take a look. Don’t go too far!
好，我們不會去太遠的地方。
Got it, we won’t go anywhere too far.

S.FORM: kai lrabwabuale, lwalranga amani lumulrevese numi.
S.TRANSL: 不要用跑的，慢慢走免得跌倒了。
Don’t run and walk slowly lest you fall down.
I want to see them right away.
How do you go to the block-house?

S.FORM: waungtinga ku ku didyusa mwa taisulasuladha.

S.TRANSL: How does he go to the hospital?
How do you go to Penghu?

S.FORM: ngwakaiya ku ki hikuki mwa Penghu.
S.TRANSL: I go to Penghu by plane.
How do you go to Penghu?

S.FORM: ngwakaiya ku ki vahukuhu mwa Penghu.
S.TRANSL: I go to Penghu by boat.
How does Muni go to school?

S.FORM: ngwakai ki kisa mugaku ku Muni.
S.TRANSL: Muni goes to school by train.
How does Usau go to church?
Usau goes to church by bicycle.
Do you go to school by MRT?
No, I go to school by bus.
Do you go to school by bicycle?
Yes, I go to school by bicycle.
Do you go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail?

S.FORM: eene, ngwakaiya ku ki kauti muTakau.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail.

S.FORM: lu muTaitu su aingukisa su ainguhikuki su?
S.TRANSL: 你去台東搭火車還是搭飛機?
Are you going to Taitung by train or by plane?
我搭飛機，搭飛機比搭火車快。
I will take the plane because it is faster than the train.

S.FORM: lu mukyukai su aingubase su aiungtingi su ku didyusa?
S.TRANSL: 你去教會搭公車還是開車?
Are you going to drive to the church or take the bus?
我開車去教會，開車比搭公車方便。
I will drive to the church because it is more convenient than the bus.
Is the market close to your house?
不近，我都騎摩托車去超市。
No, it is not, so I always ride the motorcycle to the market.
Is the post office close to the school?
Yes, it is within walking distance.
Is the restaurant close to the station?

S.FORM: lu mulatadra tisaba la dadavace ku guhungkang wakelamadu.
S.TRANSL: 出車站再走五分鐘就到了。
It only takes five minutes after you walk out of the station.
I would like to visit you.

S.FORM: yakai ku aungane li kaiasaa, pwigaigaa.
S.TRANSL: 我今天有事不在家，改天吧。
I am out today. How about another day?

S.FORM: ludhaa aipicugu su? nau silape musuwa lu makamulringedele.
S.TRANSL: 那你明天有空嗎?我下午去找你。
Then, are you available tomorrow? I’ll visit you tomorrow afternoon.

S.FORM: eene, nau ukalavalava musuwa ikai tauwana.
S.TRANSL: Sure, I will wait for you at home.

S.FORM: aimaka ruyingnga ku? nau tupacase amyamiya ku.
S.TRANSL: 請問我可以錄音嗎?我想做紀錄。
Would you mind if I do the voice recording? I would like to keep a record.
Would you mind if I do the video recording?

S.FORM: ngyalisiyana ku, la kainaku lripethele suuku, anikalisi.
S.TRANSL: 我不好看，倉庫也沒整理，不要啦。
No, I am plain and the warehouse hasn’t been tidied up yet.
Then I will just take photos.
Thank you for accepting the interview.

S.FORM: kadruwa ka aikatuma, manema ku nau kitubulru iyasu?
S.TRANSL: You are welcome. What would you like to know?

S.FORM: sa icengecenge su manema ku aungane su?
S.TRANSL: 請問您年輕時是做什麼的?
What do you do when you are young?
我以前是警察，但我現在退休了。
I was a police officer but I am retired now.
Then, are you working at the moment?

S.FORM: miyalri ikai cekele ku lalake su?
S.TRANSL: 請問您的孩子也住在部落嗎?
Do your kids live in the tribe too?
不，我的孩子在都市居住。
No, my kids are all living in the city.
Then, do you live by yourself?

S.FORM: walapuwa ku ku taupungu si adhadhame, miyalri ka wacekecekele li.
S.TRANSL: 我還有養一隻狗和一隻鳥，他們也是我的家人。
I also keep a dog and a bird. They are my family.

S.FORM: miyalri walapuwa ku ku ngyau, lu ikai ku nilapuwa kadruwa madu ka masepele.
S.TRANSL: 我也有養一隻貓，有動物陪伴不會無聊。
I have a cat too. I won’t get bored with the company of my pet.

S.FORM: apya kitubulruwa ku ku lrisi lu alupu.
S.TRANSL: 我想請問你關於打獵的禁忌。
I would like to ask you about the taboos of hunting.

S.FORM: bekela ku thingale li, ai ku tadulruwane li aitubalrea ku musuwa.
S.TRANSL: 我知道的不多，但我能回答的都會回答你。
I don’t know much about that, but I will tell you everything I know.

S.FORM: ku sahakaiyane numi walupu ka ladreme yakai ku lrisi?
S.TRANSL: 你們打獵的武器有什麼禁忌嗎?
Do you have any taboos about hunting weapons?

S.FORM: ku sahakaiya walupu ka satwatuma kadruwa ka aimaka hecenge ku labaybai.
S.TRANSL: 我們打獵的武器不可以讓女生碰到。
Our hunting weapons are untouchable to women.
那女人可以一起去打獵嗎?
Then, can women go hunting together?

S.FORM: ini, kadruwa ka aimaka alupu ku ababai.
S.TRANSL: 不行，女人也不可以打獵。
No, women cannot go hunting either.

S.FORM: Usau, kadruwanga ku bava tauwana, mwa lwangai.
S.TRANSL: Usau，家裡沒有米酒了，你去買米酒。
Usau, our home is out of rice wine, please go and buy some.

S.FORM: yakai tagagaa ku akueanga, asi langai!
S.TRANSL: 廚房裡還有一瓶，不用買吧!
There is still one bottle left in the kitchen, so there is no need to buy one!

S.FORM: kadruwa ka mwakelrete kwani akuaeaea, mwana lwangai ku akuadrusa.
S.TRANSL: 一瓶不夠，再去買兩瓶回來。
One bottle is not enough for me, go and buy two more back.

S.FORM: ailangadha ku ku bava, kyalangalangai numi?
S.TRANSL: 我要買米酒，你們有賣嗎?
I am looking for rice wine. Do you have any rice wine?
Yes! How many bottles do you need?

S.FORM: aipakudrusa ku, lai langaiyanana ku ku akuaea ku pagai.
S.TRANSL: 我要買兩瓶，還要買一包米。
I want two bottles and a pack of rice.

S.FORM: kaivai pagai, manemaneana ku alangadhane su?
S.TRANSL: 米在這裡，你還需要什麼嗎?
Here is the rice, what else do you need?

S.FORM: ailangaiyanana ku ku batuku, yakai numiya?
S.TRANSL: I want some eggs too, do you have some?
I want to buy some clothes.
What kind of clothes do you like?

S.FORM: ailangadha ku ku ngengetele ku alrimaa.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy the clothes with short sleeves.
We have white and blue ones too.
請給我一件藍色的衣服。
Please give me the clothes in blue.

S.FORM: Usau, amwa su inu kuasaa? waungdu su?
S.TRANSL: Usau你剛剛去哪裡了?你去運動嗎?
Usau, where have you been just now? Did you go exercising?

S.FORM: ini, palribula ku ki kaingu lwangai ku lacenge.
S.TRANSL: No, I went grocery shopping for my grandma.

S.FORM: iya! aipicugu su lumaungu? nai kahedele ta kwane ku aga.
S.TRANSL: 這樣啊，你晚上有沒有空?要不要和我一起吃飯。
No wonder! Are you available at night? Would you like to have a meal with me?
No, I want to buy some clothes.
Then, I will go with you.

S.FORM: sabau, piya ku salangadha ikai lacenge?
S.TRANSL: 你好，請問這把菜多少錢?
Hello, how much is this bunch of vegetables?
The vegetables are $20 for a bunch.
How much are these sweet potatoes?
Sweet potatoes are thirty dollars for a pound.

S.FORM: bwaadhai li ku drusa ka taeheca ku lacenge si ea ka tingitingi ku buhasi.
S.TRANSL: 請給我兩把菜和一斤地瓜。
Please give me two bunches of vegetables and a pound of sweet potatoes.

S.FORM: Usau, mahimuha ku ku cingpi, aimaka pakisalru su nakuwa?
S.TRANSL: Usau，我忘了帶筆，你可以借我嗎?
Usau, I forgot to bring my pen. Can you lend me one?

S.FORM: miyalriya ku kai iluku, yaki Muni kaivai.
S.TRANSL: I don’t have one either. This is Muni’s.

S.FORM: aimaka pakisalru su nakuwa padalru? aisaha saulriya ku musuwa.
S.TRANSL: 那可以借我一下子嗎?我很快就還你。
Can you lend me the pen for a second? I will return to you immediately.
Thank you and thank Muni for me.

S.FORM: aisaulriya ku ikai drusa ka hungu.
S.TRANSL: I want to return these two books.
No problem and what else do you need?

S.FORM: aikisalruwanana ku ikai tulru ka hungu.
S.TRANSL: I would like to borrow these three books.

S.FORM: eene, ngulringava swaulri lu makatulrulunga ku vai.
S.TRANSL: 好了，記得三天後要拿來還。
Sure and remember to return them after three days.

S.FORM: kadruwa su ka wasaulriyana nakuwa idra sasupisupilra.
S.TRANSL: You haven’t returned me the eraser.
那我的橡皮擦怎麼不見了。
Then, why is my eraser missing?
Did you lend it to Usau?
I don’t know. I will go and ask her.

S.FORM: nau pakisalruwana musuwa ikai sasupisupilrane li.
S.TRANSL: I will lend you my eraser first.

S.FORM: Muni, kaivai ebele pakisalru musawa ki Usau?
S.TRANSL: Muni, did Usau lend you this coat?

S.FORM: ini, langai ki ina bwaai nakuwa.
S.TRANSL: 不是，這是我媽媽買給我的
No, my mom bought it for me.

S.FORM: kudra ebele ki Usau mahahamau inya yasu.
S.TRANSL: Usau’s coat is the same as yours.

S.FORM: icecelrenge kudra ebele ini, makakaela ku kulau.
S.TRANSL: 他的外套是黑色的，我們的顏色不一樣。
His coat is black, so our colors are different.

S.FORM: Muni, kyasalru su ki Usau ku paisu?
S.TRANSL: Muni, did you borrow money from Usau?

S.FORM: eene, nau saulri kaiasaa amiya ku, mahimuha ku kai iluku ku paisu.
S.TRANSL: 有，我本來今天要還他，我忘記帶錢了。
Yes, I was supposed to return to him today, but I forgot to bring the money.
Then, when will you return the money?
I will return to him tomorrow.

S.FORM: eene, nau palribulunga musuwa pelaela ki Usau.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I will tell Usau for you.

S.FORM: kai tulriki ahakai madu ku taenge, kai tikuhai ahakai madu ku nipalrea, lumiyainiya pacengecenge.
S.TRANSL: 老鼠應該要⽤⽯壓式陷阱抓，⽵雞應該要⽤套頸式陷阱抓，這樣才對。
It is correct to catch mice through rangay and catch bamboo partridges through qjiulang.

S.FORM: lanika myaiyainiya, pasalrisalriva ku, thahepana ku kai makapwalralra.
S.TRANSL: 原來是這樣，我都搞錯了！難怪我都抓不到。
No wonder! I am mistaken and that’s why I cannot catch any of them.

S.FORM: lubibilrili nau bulrunga musuwa dwahepe ikaivai taidrusaa ka tukulru.
S.TRANSL: 那我再教你怎麼製作這兩種陷阱。
Then I will teach you how to set up these two traps.

S.FORM: eene, alamatiyakihagai! lubibilrili aidulrungana ku pwalra ku pana.
S.TRANSL: 好啊！太棒了！這樣我以後就會抓到獵物了。
Great! I will be able to catch the prey in the future.

S.FORM: madrawnga ku ubulu umawma, mwa suuku malra ku kulringi, la ta mumawma.
S.TRANSL: 田裡的草太長了，你去倉庫拿鐮刀，我們去田裡。
The grass in the fields is too tall. Go to the warehouse to take the sickle and let’s go to the fields.

S.FORM: yathiili ki hevehe, sana mudaane su ki suuku aiceele su.
S.TRANSL: 在圓簍的旁邊，你進去倉庫就會看到了。
It is next to the round basket. You will see it when you enter the warehouse.

S.FORM: cwaceela, amanilu kadula su, mahangisi kudra kulringi.
S.TRANSL: 小心拿，不要受傷。鐮刀很利。
Be careful and don’t get hurt. The sickle is very sharp.

S.FORM: yakai inya lebe ki angatu ku tukulru li.
S.TRANSL: 我的陷阱在那棵樹的下面。
My trap is under that tree.

S.FORM: yakai ku sapatuthingalane li, wathingala ku ku taikaiya idra tukulru li.
S.TRANSL: 我在這邊有做記號，我知道我的陷阱在哪裡。
I make a mark here, so I know where my trap is.

S.FORM: kaivai ka thaliduku, pyakai nai ki drakehale si tukaange.
S.TRANSL: 這是魚筌，我們放在溪邊捕魚。
This is a fish trap which we put beside the river for fishing.

S.FORM: kadruwa ku thaliduku ikai talikai nai, ahakai nai ku lalikilika tukaange.
S.TRANSL: 我們那邊沒有魚筌，我們都用釣竿抓魚。
We don’t have any fish traps there, so we catch fish with a fishing rod.

S.FORM: kadruwanaka ahakaiyana ku lalikilika lrwakuili, bulruwai li lubibilrili?
S.TRANSL: 我沒有用過釣竿，你下次教我好嗎?
I have never used a fishing rod before, would you mind teaching me next time?
好啊!我們下次一起去釣魚。
Sure! Let’s go fishing together next time.

S.FORM: nau bulrunga musuwa lubibilrili dwahepe ku thaliduku.
S.TRANSL: I will teach you how to make a fish trap next time.

S.FORM: ngyavelevele kwani lalikilikane su, asi ikai ku kaange ku kyakaili! lrwabwala bilibili.
S.TRANSL: 你的釣竿動了，是不是有魚上鉤了!你快拉起來。
Your fishing rod is moving. Isn’t the fish on the hook? Pull it up!

S.FORM: drengehana, malaliyukai kaivai vahukuhu. nau ikai ikaivai bilibili inya lalikilika, mwa nakauwai malra idra lravathe.
S.TRANSL: 等等，船太晃了。我在這邊拉釣竿，你去那邊幫我拿網子來。
Wait, the ship is rolling heavily. I am here to pull the fishing rod and you should go there to grab me the net.

S.FORM: bilibila papiya nakuwa inya kaange, nau palribulu musuwa bilibili.
S.TRANSL: 你把魚拉到我這邊，我幫妳拉起來。
Pull the fish to my side and I will help you pull it up.

S.FORM: alamaesai! savaiyane ta kaiasaa, syaetenga ki humuku.
S.TRANSL: 太好了!今天大豐收，魚簍都裝滿了。
Great! It is a bumper crop today with full fish baskets.

S.FORM: ila ta saha ubalriyu pakisupilri ki sakacekele ta.
S.TRANSL: 我們快回去和大家分享。
Let’s go back immediately and share it with everyone.
不要再玩了，快坐在座位上。
Stop playing and quickly sit in your seat.

S.FORM: kayasaa singci lrima, ludhaa taibalriva, ilata kahedele avavaehe!
S.TRANSL: 今天星期五，明天放假，一起出去玩吧!
It’s Friday today, we have a day off tomorrow. Let’s go out and play together!
Great! Let’s go to the riverside.
What day will it be tomorrow?

S.FORM: ludhaa singci tulru, lu makamulringedele ludhaa ilata ngimaimalri!
S.TRANSL: 明天星期三，我們明天下午去玩球吧!
Tomorrow will be Wednesday. Let’s go play ball tomorrow afternoon!
What will you be doing tomorrow morning?

S.FORM: ludha niciyubi, aikahedelaku ki ina mukyukai.
S.TRANSL: 明天是星期日，我要和媽媽去教會。
Tomorrow will be Sunday, I will be going to church with my mom.
I feel like vomiting. I need to go to the restroom.
老師，我肚子痛，要去廁所。
Teacher, I have a stomachache. I need to go to the restroom.
May I go wash my hands?
It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

S.FORM: singsi, waangeange kay aulruli, aiibalrivaku lumyaiyaubu.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我頭好痛，下午要請假。
Teacher, I have a severe headache. I need to take a sick leave in the afternoon.
Okay, take care and go home.

S.FORM: singsi, lubibilrili ki singci ea aiibalrivaku, aikiceelaku ki kwisang.
S.TRANSL: 老師我下禮拜一要請假，我要去看醫生。
Teacher, I need to take a sick leave next Monday. I have to see a doctor.
She has a stomachache. She’s in the restroom.

S.FORM: singsi, ku Kui kyaangeange ki cilulra, aiibalriyu kayasaa.
S.TRANSL: Teacher, Kui has a sore throat. She took a sick leave today.

S.FORM: sya Sulaku, kay caili kay tahamangealenga ku cailili.
S.TRANSL: My name is Sulaku, and I’m 10 years old.
What ethnic group are you from?
你的家人都是原住民嗎?
Are all your family members indigenous?

S.FORM: eene, kunai ka wacekecekele Ngudradrekainai makanaelre.
S.TRANSL: 是的，我們全家都是魯凱族人。
Yes, my whole family is Rukai.
你的家人都是原住民嗎?
Are all your family members indigenous?

S.FORM: ini, ku ama Ngudradrekai, ku ina paihange.
S.TRANSL: 不是，我的爸爸是魯凱族，我的媽媽是漢人。
No, my father is Rukai, and my mother is Han Taiwanese.
那位是你爸爸嗎? 他幾歲了?
Is that your father? How old is he?
那位是你爸爸嗎? 他幾歲了?
Is that your father? How old is he?

S.FORM: ini, mahudrange ki cekelenai, tahamavalrulunga ku cailini.
S.TRANSL: 不是，他是我們部落的耆老，他80歲了。
No, he is an elder of our tribe. He is 80 years old.

S.FORM: tahapiyanga ku caili ki taka ka sauwalai?
ku kake ka sauwalai tahamangealenga si valru ku cailini.
ku taka ka sauwalai ku cailini takataka musuwa ku makalra?
S.TRANSL: 你哥哥年紀比你大很多嗎?
Is your brother much older than you?

S.FORM: ku elrenganeli idai si masupatele ka kunghweng.
maulaingata kai macaceele, asu myaki wasuwainga kaelrenge?
S.TRANSL: 好久不見，你是不是長高了?
I haven’t seen you in a while. Have you grown taller?

S.FORM: eene, kunaku idainga si matulrulu ka kunghweng ku elrenganeli.

S.TRANSL: I’m going to the office to see the teacher.
He’s going to throw away the trash.

S.FORM: yakai talawlawlangudha, luasaa aikipaelre ki makalrwalrmale ki lawlangui.
S.TRANSL: 他在游泳池，他等一下要比賽游泳。
He’s at the swimming pool. He’s going to compete in a swimming competition later.

S.FORM: yakai inu ku Muni? aikikalrumale ki laylai luasaa.
S.TRANSL: Muni在哪裡?她等一下要比賽跑步。
Where is Muni? She’s going to compete in a running competition later.
She’s in the auditorium. I’ll go call her.
Let’s go to the playground together.

S.FORM: nau lanagaiyana ku kwalre, luasaa naukelanga silape musuwa.
S.TRANSL: 我先去買午餐，等一下去找你。
I’ll go buy lunch first, and then I’ll meet you later.
Let’s carry the lunch boxes together!

S.FORM: silapa ku druma, aisilapaku ki singsi.
S.TRANSL: 你找別人，我要去找老師。
You find someone else, I’m going to find the teacher.

S.FORM: ku Kui kayasaa aikikalrumale ki wadrudrumulru ki malri?
S.TRANSL: Is Kui competing in croquet today?
No, he’s competing in high jump.

S.FORM: lu atalrabwabwala idra vayvai yakai ku akipaelreanesu?
S.TRANSL: 運動會那天你會上場比賽嗎?
Will you compete in the sports day?

S.FORM: lu atalrabwabwala idra vayvai yakai ku akipaelreanesu?
S.TRANSL: 運動會那天你會上場比賽嗎?
Will you compete in the sports day?
我們運動會那天要做甚麼?
What will we do in the sports day?
We will compete in tug of war.
我們運動會要賣食物嗎?
Will we sell food at the sports day?
你獲得了第一名耶，真是厲害！
Congratulations on getting first place! You’re amazing!
Yes, she’s sleeping in her room.
不在，她剛出去了，要晚上才回家。
No, she’s not. She just went out and will be back in the evening.
他在二樓，你上去找他吧。
He’s upstairs. You can go up and find him.

S.FORM: lanika Sula, maulaingata kaiceele musuwa. mwadringadringaisu?
S.TRANSL: 是Sula阿，很久沒有看到你了，你好嗎?
It’s Sula. I haven’t seen you in a while! How have you been?
I’m doing great! I came to chat with you.
他在廚房炒菜，我去叫他。
He’s in the kitchen cooking. Let me go call him.
She went to the chicken coop to catch chickens.

S.FORM: kadruwa ku tumunumi, yakai umawma, ikaiya tauwana wadradrau iniya.
S.TRANSL: 你們的爺爺不在家，他在田裡，你們在家等他回來吧。
Your grandfather is not at home. He’s in the field. Wait for him to come back.
I haven’t seen you in a while. You’ve grown taller.
It’s so good to see you.

S.FORM: kaivai abadha numiya ka pangudrale, pudringadha pikai ki pingsyang.
S.TRANSL: 這是給你們的鳳梨，要放到冰箱裡。
Here’s a pineapple for you. Put it in the refrigerator.

S.FORM: ani kaikelakela, nau dauluwana anikela kwane ikay aga.
S.TRANSL: 這麼久沒來，我叫大家一起來吃飯。
It’s been a while. Let’s have a meal together.

S.FORM: aikatuma, sana ungulaku ikay uciya makakelrete, taikai zimusu kalaelaelange.
S.TRANSL: 不用麻煩了，我喝茶就好，我們來客廳聊天。
No need to bother. I’ll just have tea. Let’s sit in the living room and chat.
謝謝你的招待，我要回去了。
Thank you for your hospitality. I have to go now.

S.FORM: niculuculuwa kay tahukuku, iluka si ngilalalalrange kwane.
S.TRANSL: 這隻雞剛殺好，你帶回去慢慢吃。
This chicken was just freshly killed. Take it home and enjoy it slowly.

S.FORM: nau ila musuwa lu makamulringedele ludhaa ene?
S.TRANSL: 我和您約明天下午好嗎?
Can I make an appointment with you tomorrow afternoon?
我們約學校好嗎?我們要錄影。
How about meeting at school? We need to shoot a video.

S.FORM: taikai hahubuwa amani, tasikahingalai ku kacalrilrisiyana.
S.TRANSL: 那去聚會所好了，我會穿族服去。
Then let’s go to the community center. I’ll wear folk costume.

S.FORM: ku sakera ki cekelenai lungipaipai maela ki thahihi. lu ngipaipainga puhana kelangaili silape.
S.TRANSL: 我們部落的櫻花盛開很漂亮。等花開的時候你來找我吧!
The cherry blossoms in our tribe are beautiful when they bloom. Come find me when the flowers bloom!

S.FORM: laikaita mukalava pakela ki kalahyahiga, kai ngyalalrange tuhamuhu!
S.TRANSL: 那要等到春天，太晚了吧!
That would have to wait until spring. It’s too late, isn’t it?
那你豐年祭的時候來吧!
Then come during our Harvest Festival!
Alright! I’m looking forward to it!
請問你為甚麼要搬回部落生活?
May I ask why you decided to move back to the tribe?
I want to return to teach at the local school.
Why not teach in the city?

S.FORM: mabahengehaku ki cekeleli, lasidramaku ku apangibilriya ki cekele.
S.TRANSL: 因為我懷念我的故鄉，也希望能回饋部落。
Because I miss my hometown and I also want to give back to the tribe.

S.FORM: malrigilisu tinunu, anea ku wabulru musuwa?
S.TRANSL: 你很會織布，是誰教你的?
You’re very skilled at weaving, who taught you?

S.FORM: amani ku kaingu, amani ku malrilrigilinga tinunu ki cekelenai.
S.TRANSL: 是我的奶奶，她是我們部落最會織布的人。
It was my grandmother, she is the most skilled weaver in our tribe.
How did you develop an interest in learning weaving?

S.FORM: kay watinunu kakuakudhaneta, apya pacungulaku ikay kakuakudhaneta.
S.TRANSL: 織布是我們的文化，我想要讓文化延續。
Weaving is a part of our culture, and I want to ensure its continuity.
你真厲害，這要釀很久嗎?
You’re really talented. Does it take a long time to make?

S.FORM: ini, aimakapitulu. wasalengemadu ku becenge si tubuungu, lathalre pakamamelre, lupuliyunga pauwa ki dilrungu, la pauwanga ku bae.
S.TRANSL: 不用，大約一周就好了。把脫殼小米泡水後搗成粉，攪拌至稠狀，裝到甕裡，加入紅藜粉就可以了。
No, it only takes about a week. Pound the hulled millet into flour after soaking it in water, stir it until it thickens, put it into an urn and add red quinoa powder to it.

S.FORM: yakai kay tavangulu si rakyu, ngilralredrekeli demedeme.
S.TRANSL: 我這裡有辣椒和蕗蕎，都是我自己種的喔!
I have chili and lokiy, both grown by myself!

S.FORM: elrelree drusa ka idai si malrimale.

S.TRANSL: 我喜歡這件衣服，多少錢?
I like this piece of clothing. How much is it?
It’s too expensive. Can’t you lower the price a bit?
No, if I lower it further, I’ll lose money.
好吧!那我要一件黑色的衣服。
Alright then, I’ll take a black piece of clothing.
我要這把刀和這個鍋子。
I want this knife and this pot.

S.FORM: elrelre drusa ka kudrulu, ngikakamanili ahaalrima dwahepe, aitaha kaulaisu ahakai.
S.TRANSL: 總共2000元，這是我自己手工打造的，保證可以用很久。
It’s a total of 2000 dollars. I handmade these, and they are guaranteed to last a long time.

S.FORM: lu syukadhaku ku talrailragili kela lwangai, aidulrusu tupadulru?
S.TRANSL: 我介紹朋友來買，可以再便宜一些嗎?
I’ll introduce my friend to buy. Can you give a further discount?

S.FORM: eene! nautupadulru ku supate ka idai.
S.TRANSL: Alright! I’ll give you a 20% discount.

S.FORM: nyama ceela! yakai kay talrupunu si kahingalai kay akilangadha.
S.TRANSL: 來看看喔!衣服帽子都有賣。
Come and take a look! We sell clothes and hats.

S.FORM: ku ea tulru ka idai si malrimale, lu ngutulrua kudrulu.
S.TRANSL: One piece of clothing is 350 dollars, three pieces for 1000 dollars.
我買一件就好，請給我新的。
I’ll just buy one piece, please give me a new one.

S.FORM: sabau, ailangadhaku ku duhai ka aga si niceheba ki makau ka beate.
S.TRANSL: 你好，我想要買糯米飯和山胡椒滷肉。
Hello, I would like to buy sticky rice and braised pork with maqaw pepper.

S.FORM: kadruwanga ku aga. yakaiyana kay nipaibuwa ki tana ka tingpera ailangaisu?
S.TRANSL: 飯賣完了。我還有刺蔥油餅，你要買嗎?
The rice is sold out. I have tana pancakes, would you like to buy them?

S.FORM: eene, bwadhaili pakaea, lubibilrili naukelanga lwangai ku aga.
S.TRANSL: 好吧!請給我一份，我下次再來買飯。
Alright, please give me one. I’ll come back next time to buy rice.

S.FORM: eene, tanau cabu, kayvai malrimale ka balrula.
S.TRANSL: W：好，我幫你用袋子裝起來，這樣50元。
Okay, I’ll pack it in a bag for you. That’ll be 50 dollars.
